declarations.name: ON_MODAL_CLOSE_EVENT
declarations.description: Event name for when the modal is closed.

declarations.name: ON_MODAL_OPEN_EVENT
declarations.description: Event name for when the modal is opened.

members.name: _handleModalOpened
members.description: Opens the dialog element and disables page scrolling

members.name: _handleModalClosed
members.description: Closes the dialog element and re-enables page scrolling

members.name: _triggerCloseModal
members.description:
This is only to be used inside the component template as direct property
reassignment is not allowed.

members.name: _handleDialogLightDismiss
members.description: Dismisses the modal on backdrop click

members.name: _dispatchModalCloseEvent
members.description:
Dispatch `ON_MODAL_CLOSE_EVENT` event.
To be used whenever we close the modal.

members.name: _dispatchModalOpenEvent
members.description:
Dispatch `ON_MODAL_OPEN_EVENT` event.
To be used whenever we open the modal.

members.name: isRTL
members.description:
Returns true if the element is in Right to Left mode.
If a dir attribute is not explicitly set on the web component
then it falls back to the nearest parent with a dir attribute set.

A dir attribute being set will result in a reactive property.
If the component falls back to a parent dir attribute then the value
will not be reactive and is only computed once

members.name: isRTL
members.description:

If a dir attribute is not explicitly set on the web component

will not be reactive and is only computed once

declarations.name: requiredProperty
declarations.description:
A decorator for marking a property as required.
If the property's value is `undefined`, `null` or empty string, an error is logged.

declarations.name: getAllPropCombinations

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description:
The object containing properties for which combinations are to be generated.
Each property value can any data type.

declarations.description: Generate all possible combinations of properties for a given object.

declarations.name: splitCombinationsByPropertyValue

parameters.name: propValueCombinations
parameters.description: The array of combinations to split.

declarations.description: Splits an array of component prop combinations by a particular property value.

declarations.name: validPropertyValues

parameters.name: defaultValue
parameters.description: The value to fall back on

declarations.description:
A decorator for specifying a list of valid values for a property.
If this property's setter is called with an invalid value, an error is logged and the default value will be assigned instead.

declarations.name: getAllPropCombinations

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description:
The object containing properties for which combinations are to be generated.
Each property value can any data type.

declarations.description: Generate all possible combinations of properties for a given object.

declarations.name: splitCombinationsByPropertyValue

parameters.name: propValueCombinations
parameters.description: The array of combinations to split.

declarations.description: Splits an array of component prop combinations by a particular property value.

This is a Web Component used for visual testing purposes.
It allows us to wrap a component we'd like to test in a container
that displays the component's props as a label.

Alternatively, this component supports a page mode. In this mode,
the test component is not wrapped and labelled, however you can add
any amount of HTML to the page to help with testing. This useful for components
such as Modal and Dialog components where we need to test the component in the context of
the page markup.

Components can be tested without this, but it's useful if your tests
require additional markup when testing a component.
declarations.name: WebComponentTestWrapper

members.name: propKeyValues
members.description:
The prop key and values to display above the component.
This should be a single string representing a comma separated list of prop key/value pairs.
Such as: 'size: small, isFullWidth: true'

members.name: pageMode
members.description:
Use in combination with the `pageMarkup` named slot to render the component alongside additional HTML
to test the component in the context of the page.
